title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 July 2014 - XWiki
content:
<abusenius> has quit  
01:34 <Lyes1> has quit  
04:46 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
04:59 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
05:01 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
05:13 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
06:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:56 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:36 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <tmortagne> it's weird, looks like for some reason ohloh did not updated XWiki since more than a week, does not seems to be the case for other projects  
08:53 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:56 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <tmortagne> Enygma`: you could do branches instead of pull requests :)  
09:12 <Enygma`> tmortagne: they were already branches, I just found it easier to merge them with a pull request (2 clicks) :)  
09:12 <Enygma`> maybe you meant "merges" instead of "branches"  
09:13 <mflorea> has quit  
09:14 <tmortagne> actually I meant branch, http://git.io/yT04gg being a pull request I tough it was  
09:14 <tmortagne> from the start (without me noticing it)  
09:15 <tmortagne> there is an issue in one pom by the way  
09:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <vmassol> Enygma`: good morning  
09:15 <Enygma`> vmassol: good morning  
09:15 <vmassol> Enygma`: you haven't replied to my mail regarding helping with the XWiki Days! :)  
09:16 <Enygma`> tmortagne: which one?  
09:16 <tmortagne> see my last git comment  
09:24 <vmassol> cool, thanks Enygma` :)  
09:25 <vmassol> so let's start with next Thursday (today is a bit too last-moment I guess ;))  
09:25 <vmassol> ah and next thursday is travelling day for a lot of committers ;)  
09:25 <vmassol> (the ones from XWiki SAS at least)  
09:25 <Enygma`> lucky me, huh? :)  
09:26 <vmassol> you picked your timing well!  
09:27 <vmassol> one thing, ideally you need to check the metrics associated with the various XWiki Days  
09:27 <vmassol> in order to propose a specific day  
09:27 <vmassol> there's one thing I'd like to keep that I was doing  
09:27 <vmassol> it's checking regularly on the bugs closed/bugs created metric  
09:27 <vmassol> in order to keep more bugs closed than created for the past 1600 days  
09:28 <vmassol> so when we were loosing I was proposing a BFD but it seems we only needed once out of 2-3 times to keep up  
09:28 <vmassol> right now we're at:  
09:29 <vmassol> 3628 closed vs 3621 created  
09:29 <vmassol> so we're winning  
09:29 <vmassol> and no need for a BFD  
09:30 <Enygma`> I see  
09:31 <vmassol> dashboard is here if you don't have it already http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10352  
09:31 <vmassol> (top right)  
09:32 <vmassol> we're only 375 bugs away in total btw, not too bad  
09:34 <vmassol> I wonder what feeling it is to have 0 bugs opened :)  
09:34 <vmassol> must be great  
09:34 <vmassol> feeling that you're on top of your software  
09:35 <vmassol> s/opened/open  
09:35 <Enygma`> or sad that you software is not used enough :P  
09:35 <Enygma`> there`s no such thing as 0 bugs software :)  
09:35 <vmassol> yeah it needs to be combined with active installs to ensure this doesn't happen :)  
09:35 <vmassol> I didn't say no bug  
09:35 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <vmassol> I said no bug open  
09:35 <vmassol> :)  
09:35 <Enygma`> opened  
09:35 <Enygma`> :)  
09:35 <vmassol> not even opened, because when they're opened you closed them  
09:36 <vmassol> within, say, 1 week  
09:36 <vmassol> must be pretty cool  
09:36 <Enygma`> it would also mean that you`ve stopped development for your software a long time ago and only focused on bugs :)  
09:36 <vmassol> I guess there are really complex bugs, maybe they can recateogrized as improvmeents ;)  
09:36 <Enygma`> and the fixes you introduced brought no new bugs :)  
09:36 <vmassol> I don't know about that  
09:37 <vmassol> for ex with 1 BFD per day for a year we caught up a lot  
09:37 <Enygma`> yep  
09:37 <vmassol> that still leaves 4 days per week on other stuff  
09:37 <vmassol> now the remaining 100 bugs or so must be real hard  
09:38 <Enygma`> yeah, some of them might need serious refactorings or model changes and stuff  
09:38 <vmassol> that's why I said  
09:38 <vmassol> they could be relabelled as improvements maybe  
09:38 <Enygma`> yes, some of them maybe  
09:38 <vmassol> for example if we take this one:  http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-1716  
09:38 <vmassol> this can be considered a limitation  
09:38 <vmassol> (thus an improvement)  
09:38 <vmassol> and not necessarily a bug  
09:39 <vmassol> but then it might be cheating…. ;) dunno  
09:39 <vmassol> in any case this one is doable  
09:39 <vmassol> (second oldest open bug)  
09:40 <vmassol> I like the widget on bottom right of the dashboard http://jira.xwiki.org/secure/Dashboard.jspa?selectPageId=10352  
09:40 <vmassol> shows the versions of xwiki still having open bugs  
09:41 <vmassol> fun that old versions have 1 bug open each  
09:41 <vmassol> (till 1.1M3)  
09:42 <vmassol> ah no stupid me  
09:42 <vmassol> it's ordered by # of open bugs  
09:42 <vmassol> ahaha  
09:43 <Enygma`> well, they are still open  
09:43 <Enygma`> 1 for each of those versions  
09:43 <vmassol> yeah  
10:05 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
12:01 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
12:05 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki

13:25 <vmassol> sdumitriu: functional tests seem broken: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/2fd5da776f730a2a5ecd/raw/80144a9298105c359ddf4029aee4d5fefd46825d/gistfile1.txt

13:30 <woshilapin> has quit

14:05 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
14:05 <Lyes2> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <Lyes1> has quit  
14:07 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <OSIMasson> has left #xwiki  
14:41 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
14:44 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <DarkKnightCZ> hi, configuration from xwiki.properties is available through XWiki.getConfig().getProperty(key,default)?  
14:52 <vmassol> nope  
14:53 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: you should use the Configuration module  
14:53 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Configuration+Module  
14:54 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: let us know what you wish to do  
14:54 <vmassol> otherwise it's hard to help you  
14:54 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
14:56 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: yup, great, this is what i was looking for  
14:59 <msmeria> has quit  
16:22 <Lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
16:29 <vmassol> mflorea: File Manager Application would be better than File Manager Application UI IMO  
16:29 <vmassol> (for the EM name)  
16:29 <vmassol> at least that's what we use elsewhere  
16:29 <mflorea> ok  
16:30 <vmassol> in general we use: "XXX Application" for the UI and "XXX API" for any java api  
16:31 <Lyes2> has quit  
16:44 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
16:52 <vmassol> anyone remembers the format for a 7005 clirr ignore for a constructor?  
16:52 <vmassol> I have this: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/vmassol/f444f2d36006950ad698/raw/ad794c68fc36dd929bc467526409acfffdf515dc/gistfile1.txt  
16:52 <vmassol> been banging my head… :)  
16:54 <tmortagne> vmassol: did you tried without "public " ? I never put that part in general  
16:54 <vmassol> yeah  
16:54 <vmassol> I tried  
16:54 <vmassol> it's a constrcutor so there must be something special  
16:56 <andreeapopescu\_> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <tmortagne> did you tried method without "public" and to with "public"  
16:56 <tmortagne> ?  
16:56 <vmassol> I tried that I think,  
16:56 <vmassol> trying again  
16:56 <tmortagne> method officially never contains "public"in the documentation, to description is not that clear  
16:56 <vmassol> hmm maybe it's not <method> but <constructor> or something like this but I doubt i  
16:57 <vmassol> no deice  
16:57 <vmassol> dice  
16:57 <tmortagne> I don't think so  
16:57 <tmortagne> unless http://mojo.codehaus.org/clirr-maven-plugin/examples/ignored-differences.html is wrong  
16:57 <vmassol> indeed http://mojo.codehaus.org/clirr-maven-plugin/examples/ignored-differences.html  
16:57 <vmassol> yep  
16:58 <vmassol> I also tried with \* instead of public  
16:59 <vmassol> ah found something that works  
16:59 <vmassol> <method>MimeMessageWrapper\*</method>  
16:59 <tmortagne> you will have to find a 7005 in the history :)  
16:59 <vmassol> I tried that too  
17:00 <vmassol> but couldn't find a constructor example ;)  
17:00 <vmassol> anyway  
17:00 <vmassol> got something that passes, good enough for me  
17:00 <tmortagne> another possibility is to not break the API :)  
17:02 <andreeapopescu> has quit  
17:02 <mflorea> has quit  
17:02 <andreeapopescu\_> is now known as <andreeapopescu>  
17:03 <evalica> has quit  
17:04 <vmassol> yeah sure  
17:04 <vmassol> and not progress  
17:04 <vmassol> :)  
17:06 <vmassol> strange, my avatar has changed on github  
17:06 <vmassol> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commits/master  
17:06 <vmassol> hmm https://github.com/vmassol shows the right avatar though  
17:06 <tmortagne> I see the same in both link  
17:07 <tmortagne> links  
17:07 <vmassol> re-uploading picture  
17:07 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
17:08 <vmassol> I think they changed the max pic size  
17:08 <vmassol> or something like that  
17:08 <vmassol> I tried to upload the same again and they said it must be < 1MB  
17:09 <vmassol> hmmm still not updated  
17:09 <tmortagne> try to clean your cache or something, I have the same image in both links  
17:09 <vmassol> you have a picture or some art image?  
17:09 <vmassol> it's ok now  
17:10 <vmassol> thanks  
17:10 <Enygma`> has quit  
17:10 <vmassol> very strange  
17:10 <vmassol> I push a commit  
17:10 <vmassol> which locally has the pom.xml change for clirr  
17:10 <vmassol> and on the server it doesn't contain it  
17:12 <vmassol> anyway  
17:12 <vmassol> pushed again  
17:25 <woshilapin> Hi xwikiers  
17:26 <woshilapin> I found a missing translations in ApplicationResources\_fr.properties (and in all the other languages by the way but I can't do it)  
17:26 <woshilapin> I wonder what the best way of fixing it  
17:26 <woshilapin> Because I was one the verge of creating a simple pull request for this missing key  
17:27 <woshilapin> (for information, key is platform.appwithinminutes.appHomePageDeleteEntriesLabel)  
17:28 <tmortagne> woshilapin: translation contributions are on http://l10n.xwiki.org  
17:28 <woshilapin> Yes, I was looking at it  
17:28 <woshilapin> Everything done there is reported directly on the Git ?  
17:28 <tmortagne> in your case it's in http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/XWikiCoreResources if I understood well  
17:29 <tmortagne> everything done here is put in git at each release  
17:29 <woshilapin> OK  
17:29 <tmortagne> it's part of the release process  
17:29 <woshilapin> So, I better do it there  
17:29 <tmortagne> yes  
17:29 <woshilapin> That was the information missing, thanks  
17:31 <tmortagne> woshilapin: note that you have "## XWiki Translation for language fr generated from http://www.l10n.xwiki.org" in ApplicationResources\_fr.properties but it's possible it's not clear enough  
17:31 <tmortagne> or maybe you did not saw it ?  
17:32 <woshilapin> I saw my key and I will propose a translation  
17:32 <woshilapin> My problem is that I know where it appears in the wiki and the exact translation may be a bit long for the UI  
17:33 <woshilapin> And in the meanwhile, I wonder how I can create this translation key in my system, without waiting for the next release  
17:34 <tmortagne> woshilapin: using http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Localization+Module#HRegisterawikitranslation for example  
17:34 <woshilapin> Is these \*.properties files are transformed into a Translation wiki page?  
17:34 <tmortagne> no  
17:34 <tmortagne> but you can overwrite then in any wiki translation page  
17:34 <tmortagne> so you can put your changes in a wiki translation page to test it  
17:34 <woshilapin> Yes, I'm aware of that but this means that the best way in my case is to create a new document with this key  
17:35 <woshilapin> What will happen when I will update to the last release  
17:35 <woshilapin> There will be 2 keys in the system  
17:36 <tmortagne> your wiki translation has priority over jar translation  
17:36 <tmortagne> so yours will be taken  
17:36 <woshilapin> Ok  
17:36 <woshilapin> So I will add my key  
17:36 <woshilapin> Thanks  
17:36 <tmortagne> this is a way you can use when you don't like default translations or want some specific naming  
17:36 <woshilapin> And back to the proposition on l10n.xwiki.org  
17:37 <woshilapin> Should I worry about the UI?  
17:37 <tmortagne> what do you mean ?  
17:38 <woshilapin> I mean, the translation will be something like twice the number of characters of the english version  
17:39 <tmortagne> ha I tough you were talking about the l10n wiki UI  
17:39 <woshilapin> It can result in bad UI  
17:39 <tmortagne> I don't know it depends where it's used and how  
17:39 <tmortagne> it's pretty much a case by case decision  
17:39 <woshilapin> A small panel with a limited width (as far as I understand)  
17:39 <woshilapin> Somebody review after me on l10n.xwiki.org ?  
17:40 <tmortagne> All I can suggest is to test it  
17:40 <woshilapin> Yes, I will, of course :-)  
17:40 <tmortagne> there is no real official systematic review before a release no but there will probably be bug report or new contribution if your translation does not fit well  
17:41 <tmortagne> and it depends a lot on the language  
17:41 <woshilapin> OK, I'll test, and unless it's very weird, I'll submit it to l10n.xwiki.org  
17:41 <tmortagne> French is used a lot but not always in the latest version  
17:41 <woshilapin> Thank you very much for the support  
17:42 <tmortagne> thanks you for the contribution :)  
17:46 <gdelhumeau> I got a strange bug concerning IE9, Bootstrap, and the WYSIWYG editor: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-10661  
17:46 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: maybe you have a clue?  
17:54 <mbloom> has joined #xwiki  
17:57 <mbloom> I am getting an error when I try to launch the DW “null platform.extension.distributionWizard.${currentStepId}StepTitle”  
17:59 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:00 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: I commented on jira  
18:00 <tmortagne> vmassol: you sure you want to name the project XVIDEO ? :)  
18:00 <vmassol> :)  
18:01 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: thx  
18:01 <vmassol> didn't even think about it ;)  
18:01 <vmassol> but now that you mention it, couldn't have chosen a better name!  
18:01 <vmassol> lots of people are going to want to contribute  
18:01 <vmassol> :)  
18:02 <mbloom> Any help with the DW error?  
18:03 <tmortagne> mbloom: you directly access the DW URL or you are automatically redirectly ? Usually you see that when there is no DW running and you directly access the distribution action  
18:03 <tmortagne> s/redirectly/redirected/  
18:04 <mbloom> I am trying to directly acces the url  
18:04 <tmortagne> ok then looks like the DW is finished  
18:04 <andreeapopescu> has left #xwiki  
18:04 <tmortagne> (yes we should improve a bit the distribution action display in that case...)  
18:07 <mbloom> tmortagne: thank you!  
18:15 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
18:18 <cjd> hey sburjan, how's it going?  
18:21 <vmassol> FTR just seen this in my console:  
18:21 <vmassol> 2014-07-17 18:00:00,057 [DefaultQuartzScheduler\_Worker-1] WARN  o.x.d.i.DocumentTitleDisplayer - Infinite recursion detected while displaying the title of [xwiki:Scheduler.WatchListHourlyNotifier]. Using the document name as title.  
18:24 <Lyes> has joined #xwiki  
18:24 <Lyes1> has quit  
18:26 <cjd> has quit  
18:26 <mbloom> has quit  
18:40 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
18:41 <mbloom> has joined #xwiki  
18:42 <cjd> has quit  
18:45 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ping  
18:45 <sdumitriu> vmassol: Checking the build  
18:45 <vmassol> ok  
18:45 <vmassol> thanks  
18:45 <vmassol> on a different topic: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/ProjectHealth#HContributors  
18:45 <vmassol> (there's a line related to you :))  
18:46 <sdumitriu> :)  
18:50 <vmassol> mflorea: very nice doc (as usual) :)  
18:50 <mflorea> vmassol: thanks :)  
18:51 <sdumitriu> Weird, the start script:  
18:51 <sdumitriu> 1. Doesn't recognize "shopt -s nullglob"  
18:51 <sdumitriu> 2. Doesn't find the xml files, although they are there...  
18:52 <sdumitriu> Seems the -f is the culprit  
18:54 <sdumitriu> I wonder why that flag is passed..  
18:58 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:02 <sdumitriu> I think someone thought that's how you specify a file to execute, but that flag actually disables globs  
19:04 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
19:18 <mflorea> has quit  
19:24 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
19:49 <mbloom> I am having trouble getting connected to my permanent director. I am receiving the following error: 0.x.e.ServletEnvironment - Configured permanent directory [/var/local/scd] could not be created, check permission  
19:50 <sdumitriu> mbloom: Does the directory exist?  
19:50 <mbloom> yes  
19:51 <sdumitriu> Are you using Tomcat as the container?  
19:51 <tmortagne> sounds like your application server user cannot write in /var/local/scd  
19:51 <sdumitriu> Or navigate through /var/local to it  
19:53 <sdumitriu> mbloom: Run this:  
19:53 <sdumitriu> stat  /var/ /var/local/ /var/local/scd | grep Uid  
19:53 <sdumitriu> The first two lines should contain drwxr-xr-x  
19:54 <sdumitriu> The last one should have tomcat as the owner  
19:54 <mbloom> tmortagne: this is what I got in return  
19:54 <mbloom> Access: (0755/drwxr-xr-x)  Uid: (    0/    root)   Gid: (    0/    root)  
19:54 <mbloom> Access: (0755/drwxr-xr-x)  Uid: (    0/    root)   Gid: (    0/    root)  
19:54 <mbloom> Access: (0755/drwxr-xr-x)  Uid: (    0/    root)   Gid: (    0/    root)  
19:54 <sdumitriu> mbloom: chown -R tomcat:tomcat /var/local/scd/  
19:55 <sdumitriu> (if you're using Tomcat)  
19:55 <mbloom> I am  
19:55 <tmortagne> yep it's probably a owner issue  
19:55 <tmortagne> make sure what user is used to run tomcat  
19:56 <tmortagne> you should be able to see that in top or ps  
19:56 <mbloom> what do you mean by that?  
19:58 <tmortagne> execute:  
19:58 <tmortagne> ps aux |grep java  
19:59 <tmortagne> you should get a line related to tomcat and get the user who is executing tomcat at the beginning of the line  
19:59 <tmortagne> usually it's something like tomcat or tomcat7  
19:59 <tmortagne> (for Tomcat 7)  
20:00 <mbloom> yeah it’s tomcat  
20:01 <tmortagne> then execute what sdumitriu suggested to make tomcat owner of the folder  
20:01 <sdumitriu> After that, restart tomcat  
20:01 <tmortagne> note that if you are on Debian or Ubuntu the simplest is to use XWiki debian packages  
20:01 <tmortagne> (http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/InstallationViaAPT)
